intro: Urostigma bicorne, commonly known as the two-horned bladdergrass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive two-horned spikelets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and along roadsides. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are wind-pollinated, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Urostigma bicorne is a perennial plant that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
